Rich,
The appearance of the metal, the shape of the rim and your descriptio=
n of the lamination bones in the edge all point to Akasaka.  The very small=
 size and thin plate point toward later work.  It's later than Ron's Tadash=
ige.  Bushu Ito people did use that design, but the metal and rim are diffe=
rent.  The Mosle/Izzard Ito example is in shakudo and the carving is of cou=
rse very different despite sharing the design.  

Jim
